greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First differences of A256534.
comment: Number of cells turned ON at n-th stage of cellular automaton of A256534.
Similar to A256531 which shares infinitely many terms.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Catalog of Toothpick and Cellular Automata Sequences in the OEIS
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
formula: It appears that a(n) = 4 * A241717(n-1), n >= 1.
example: With the positive terms written as an irregular triangle in which the row lengths are the terms of A011782 the sequence begins:
program: (GWBASIC) 10' a261695 First 2^z-1 terms: 20 z=6: defdbl a: for i=1 to z: for j=0 to 2^(i-1)-1: n=n+1: a(n)=4^i + 3*(2*j)^2: print a(n)-a(n-1); : next j: next i: end
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Sep 24 2015
